New Records: England became the first men's team to hold both the ODI and T20 World Cup titles simultaneously.
Key Match Events: England beat Pakistan by five wickets.
Sam Curran was named Player of the Match for his spell of 4-0-12-3.
Ben Stokes scored an unbeaten 52 off 49 balls to guide England to victory.
Shaheen Shah Afridi's injury was a turning point in the match.
Pakistan's Naseem Shah bowled a memorable spell with figures of 4-0-30-0.
England needed 138 to win and achieved it with six balls to spare.
Key wickets included Hales, Salt, Buttler, Brook, and Ali for England, and Rizwan, Babar, Iftikhar, Shan, Shadab, Nawaz, Wasim for Pakistan.
Pre-Game Insights: England won the toss and chose to bowl first.
Post-Match Reflections: Jos Buttler expressed immense pride in the team's character and performance.
Babar Azam congratulated England and praised his team's fight.
Sam Curran reflected on his adaptability and the importance of the win.
Ben Stokes emphasized the importance of learning from mistakes and moving on.
Adil Rashid acknowledged the contributions of past team members and coaches.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the MCG in front of 90,000 spectators.
The injury to Shaheen Shah Afridi was a significant moment in the game.
England's victory was celebrated by fans worldwide, including those in Israel, Italy, Kyrgyzstan, Philippines, Iceland, France, Antarctica, New York, and a south London coffee shop.
